column4: ive pasted part of /var/log/messages: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/48452/
your log shows several problems...
apart from the permissions on the 'secrets' files...
'Could not determine remote IP address: defaulting to 10.64.64.64' sounds worrying.
i've unchecked that
and replacing the default route is not a good idea usually.
should i remove the app and try connecting through network-manager?
also your firewall seemss to be blocking traffic to/from the PPP0 interface.
i running gnome. no firewall installed. what firewall do you recommend?
ubotu: actually, firestarter (i forgot)
after disabling firestarter, got the web (firefox) working. Any hints on how to solve those "holes"?
there are lots of apps that setup a PPP connection. I personally configure it manually, so I don't know which one is likely to work best for you. For some time in the past I used 'wvdial', which
what files do i have to check to get my connection secure? That 10.64.64.64 issue...
try running 'pppd' with the 'debug; option to see why the other side is not sending its address.
ok. Thanks. Ill check the ip on windowse config
one more question. It seems ubuntu is recnogizing my sata drive with errors and using it as an ide drive. is that so?
more likely it is a PATA drive where SATA=-PATA is not owrking.
it is more or less impossible for a SATA drive to be handled by a PATA driver.
its a asus laptop with a sata drive(so they say) do i have to install anything?
if the SATA chipset is not very recent porobably you don't have to install anything.
google the error messages you get.
Thanks
